Module org.microbean.invoke
Package org.microbean.invoke

Class DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T>

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.invoke.DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Supplier<T>, OptionalSupplier<T>
public final class DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> extends Object implements OptionalSupplier<T>
An OptionalSupplier that tries one Supplier first, before falling back to another one, while properly implementing the determinism() method.
Author:
Laird Nelson

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.microbean.invoke.OptionalSupplier

    OptionalSupplier.Determinism

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    final OptionalSupplier.Determinism
    determinism()
    Returns an OptionalSupplier.Determinism suitable for this DefaultingOptionalSupplier.
    final T
    get()
    Attempts to return the return value of an invocation of the Supplier.get() method on the main Supplier supplied to one of the factory methods, unless that invocation causes a NoSuchElementException or an UnsupportedOperationException to be thrown, in which case attempts to return the return value of an invocation of the Supplier.get() method on the default Supplier supplied to one of the factory methods.
    static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T>
    of()
    Returns a DefaultingOptionalSupplier whose determinism() method will always return OptionalSupplier.Determinism.ABSENT and whose get() method will always throw a NoSuchElementException or an UnsupportedOperationException.
    static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T>
    of(Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
    Returns a DefaultingOptionalSupplier with no defaults.
    static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T>
    of(Supplier<? extends T> supplier, Supplier<? extends T> defaults)
    Returns a DefaultingOptionalSupplier that will, loosely speaking, try the supplied supplier first, and, if it throws a NoSuchElementException or an UnsupportedOperationException from its Supplier.get() method, will then try the supplied defaults.

    • get

      public final T get()
      Attempts to return the return value of an invocation of the Supplier.get() method on the main Supplier supplied to one of the factory methods, unless that invocation causes a NoSuchElementException or an UnsupportedOperationException to be thrown, in which case attempts to return the return value of an invocation of the Supplier.get() method on the default Supplier supplied to one of the factory methods.
      Specified by:
      get in interface OptionalSupplier<T>
      Specified by:
      get in interface Supplier<T>
      Returns:
      the value in question, which may be null
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if no value is present
      UnsupportedOperationException - if no value is present
      See Also:

      Idempotency:

      Nullability:

      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • of

      public static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> of()
      Returns a DefaultingOptionalSupplier whose determinism() method will always return OptionalSupplier.Determinism.ABSENT and whose get() method will always throw a NoSuchElementException or an UnsupportedOperationException.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of object the returned DefaultingOptionalSupplier will supply
      Returns:
      a DefaultingOptionalSupplier whose determinism() method will always return OptionalSupplier.Determinism.ABSENT and whose get() method will always throw a NoSuchElementException or an UnsupportedOperationException
      See Also:
      • Absence.instance()
      • get()

    • of

      public static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> of(Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
      Returns a DefaultingOptionalSupplier with no defaults.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of object the returned DefaultingOptionalSupplier will supply
      Parameters:
      supplier - the Supplier in question; may be null in which case a DefaultingOptionalSupplier that behaves identically to an Absence instance will be returned
      Returns:
      a DefaultingOptionalSupplier with no defaults
      See Also:
      • Absence.instance()
      • get()
      • determinism()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method will never return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • of

      public static final <T> DefaultingOptionalSupplier<T> of(Supplier<? extends T> supplier, Supplier<? extends T> defaults)
      Returns a DefaultingOptionalSupplier that will, loosely speaking, try the supplied supplier first, and, if it throws a NoSuchElementException or an UnsupportedOperationException from its Supplier.get() method, will then try the supplied defaults.

      The supplied Supplier instances can, themselves, be OptionalSuppliers, and, if so, the resulting DefaultingOptionalSupplier will have its determinism() method appropriately implemented.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of object the returned DefaultingOptionalSupplier will supply
      Parameters:
      supplier - the first Supplier to try; may be null
      defaults - the fallback Supplier to try; may be null
      Returns:
      a DefaultingOptionalSupplier
      See Also:
      • get()
      • determinism()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
